tool_description: Kred, created by PeopleBrowsr, measures influence in online communities connected by interest. Kred values audience quality and engagement over audience size. It assesses the ability to inspire action (Influence) and propensity to engage with others (Outreach)
name: KredAPI
title: KredAPI

api_list.name: /kred/activity
api_list.description: Fetch the influence/outreach of recent activity for a user.  A 204 response means the user was not found.

required_parameters.name: source
required_parameters.description: Source of the activity, e.g. twitter

required_parameters.name: username
required_parameters.description: The username related to the source, e.g. bbcnews

optional_parameters.name: count
optional_parameters.description: The number of items to return

api_list.name: /kred/score
api_list.description: Kredentials presents the Kred score of a user in a comprehensive format that makes it simple to understand the source of their Kred score. Internally, we refer to this as an identity archive.  A 204 response means the user was not found.

required_parameters.name: source
required_parameters.description: Source of the score, e.g. twitter

required_parameters.name: username
required_parameters.description: The username related to the source, e.g. neilhimself

api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://kred-exp-v2.p.rapidapi.com/kred/score/twitter/neilhimself"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "kred-exp-v2.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://kred-exp-v2.p.rapidapi.com/kred/score/{source}/{username}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "kred-exp-v2.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
